instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad lags when charger is connected
threads.message: hello guys, Have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that works fine with the battery , but once I connect the charger the machine would start to lag, and runs really slow , <TRANSISTOR>Q5300</TRANSISTOR> voltage devision circuitry is working okay as well as <TRANSISTOR>Q5310</TRANSISTOR>, am not sure where else to look, please help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad lags when charger is connected
threads.message:
Post exact resistance between pins 17/18 snd 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage on charger only (no battery)?
